text:
:partyparrot: :rotating_light: Wanted to ping <@UJG9WTEKG> and the rest of the community about starting a *#web3* channel here on Superpath. :rotating_light::partyparrot:

I've spent the past few weeks totally immersed in the world of online decentralization. Participating in some of the economies, tackling the learning curves. It's... incredible stuff and a much bigger space than I was prepared for. It's also very nascent, messy, and chock full of wacky innovation (and pitfalls and predators :skull:).

I am reminded of the 2011-2012 period, when I started my marketing career and figured, "This social media stuff is probably going to be important." Back then, social was nascent and messy and not really mainstream outside the geekosphere. Then, as we all know, it exploded within half a decade. Based on the bubbling pressure under web3, its tech, its philosophy, and wider societal vibes... I think web3 stuff will begin to ramp at an order of magnitude faster. If for no other reason that so many more people are digitally connected compared to the 2010's.

Many Big Brands will probably take a few years to wake up to it. *Startups in the tech world and scrappier orgs are already starting to tune in and align.* As you might imagine, there is a massive need for education and onboarding `(read: content and UX)`, as many web3 pioneering efforts are weighted heavily on the technical side. Many naming conventions and signaling choices are, uh, in need of an upgrade. :eyes:

Also, the very nature of how web3 is set up presents an enormous new opportunity for freelancers or folks who want to side gig.

I'll quit pitching now, as I could go on and on. Would love to know if others' ears have started prickling with this stuff and if y'all think Superpath should have a channel for Web3 :slightly_smiling_face:

text: <@U01AHL8AGBB> whats some of the best resources you’ve come across to learn about web3

elements.text: whats some of the best resources you’ve come across to learn about web3

text: Hey <@U02CTCZEL3E> here's one that I came across last month and has some quite interesting resources

elements.text: Hey
here's one that I came across last month and has some quite interesting resources

attachments.fallback: Gaby's Notion on Notion: Gaby's Web3 Reading List
attachments.text: Crypto moves really quickly, and it can be hard to keep up. I'm using this list to save the interesting articles I read about web3. I also have a Web3 Podcast List, which you can find here: Gaby's Web3 Podcast List If you find something great that I missed, please tweet me: @gaby_goldberg
attachments.title: Gaby's Web3 Reading List

elements.text: https://gabygoldberg.notion.site/f7050e62461143d49345e7b46eb5576b?v=c02511c4230c44ce9a1a03c9757da524

text:
<@U02CTCZEL3E>

• You may want to watch this: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bBC-nXj3Ng4> if you know nothing about blockchain + proof of consensus mechanisms
• This is laid out nicely <https://behumane.notion.site/DAO-learning-material-a8f3fd280ba44a64a082cf7ed11d89a0>
• A podcast angle that starts off with the basics <https://daon-the-rabbit-hole.simplecast.com/episodes>
• <https://rabbithole.gg> (good name eh) is a new DAO that literally uses blockchain based activities to teach you stuff. Good companion articles too (you can read through w/o actually doing stuff to get a sense of what's going on)
• I also found that while not the easiest to search and filter, the social media communities on Hive has a wealth of knowledge: (<http://hive.io|hive.io> , <http://hive.blog|hive.blog>)
• For example, this is a a great primer <https://ecency.com/blockchain/@blocktrades/the-history-of-delegated-proof-of-stake-dpos>

attachments.video_html: <iframe width="400" height="225" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/bBC-nXj3Ng4?feature=oembed&autoplay=1&iv_load_policy=3" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

attachments.title: But how does bitcoin actually work?

attachments.fallback: Sara's Notion on Notion: DAO learning material
attachments.title: DAO learning material

attachments.fallback: DAOn the Rabbit Hole: Episodes | DAOn the Rabbit Hole
attachments.text: DAOn the Rabbit Hole is the official RabbitHole podcast and is the go-to podcast for people to learn about Web3. By going down the rabbit hole with experts on a variety of topics like economics, psychology, politics, history, art, technology, and more, we hope to help crypto natives and crypto-curious individuals think about how they can contribute to the Web3 ecosystem while simultaneously helping our Web2 listeners become interested in learning more.
attachments.title: Episodes | DAOn the Rabbit Hole

attachments.text: Earn crypto through discovering and using the latest crypto applications
attachments.title: Home

attachments.fallback: Ecency: The History of Delegated Proof-of-Stake (DPOS)
attachments.text: DPOS (aka Delegated Proof-of-Stake) was invented by Daniel Larimer as a replacement for the Proof-Of-Work consensus algorithm used by Bitcoi... by @blocktrades
attachments.title: The History of Delegated Proof-of-Stake (DPOS)

text: Another great resource for those who work on branding and are curious about what that means in web3, this piece on headless brands: <https://otherinter.net/research/headless-brands/>

attachments.text: Headless brands are decentralized consensus systems which facilitate emergent narratives without centralized oversight.
attachments.title: Headless Brands
